means: 立体主义，立体派(20世纪初的一种艺术流派，运用线条和几何图形表现物体)

sentence.Network_en: The paintings of Paul Ce & 1 & zanne prefigured the rise of cubism in the early 20 th century.
sentence.Network_cn: 保罗·塞尚的绘画预示了20世纪初叶立体主义的兴起.

sentence.Network_en: The movement synthesised elements of modern art that hadn't been brought together before, such as Cubism and Surrealism.
sentence.Network_cn: 该运动综合了立体派和超现实主义等以前从未同时出现过的现代艺术元素。

sentence.Network_en: Cubism is the most influential of all modern art movements.
sentence.Network_cn: 立体派是现代艺术运动中最有影响力的流派。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 立体派(Cubism)是继野兽派之后，在法国本土兴起的一个本世纪最著名的画派之一。野兽派绘画追求单纯化以及非洲黑人雕刻的造形…

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 20th cent.: from French cubisme, from cube (see cube)

entry.tran: 立体主义，立体派（20世纪初的一种艺术流派，运用线条和几何图形表现物体）
entry.def: Cubism is a style of art, begun in the early twentieth century, in which objects are represented as if they could be seen from several different positions at the same time, using many lines and geometric shapes.

means.word_mean: 1. an artistic movement in France beginning in 1907 that featured surfaces of geometrical planes

auth_sentence.content: Matisse coined the name Cubism as a derisive joke.
auth_sentence.res_content: Matisse coined the name Cubism as a derisive joke.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Matisse coined the name Cubism as a derisive joke.

auth_sentence.content: The result was almost old-fashioned: comic-book Cubism.
auth_sentence.res_content: The result was almost old-fashioned: comic-book Cubism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The result was almost old-fashioned: comic-book Cubism.

auth_sentence.content: But he never adopted Cubism's radical fragmentation of form.
auth_sentence.res_content: But he never adopted Cubism's radical fragmentation of form.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But he never adopted Cubism's radical fragmentation of form.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"具备某种性质"; 2. 表示"学术或学术流派,行业"; 3. 表示"行为,现象,状态"; 4. 表示"疾病"; 5. 名词,表示"各种主义,宗教"
